intro: Dichroma coccineum, commonly known as the scarlet dichroma, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its striking red to orange-red flowers that bloom in late spring. It typically grows in moist, acidic soils and thrives in partial to full shade. Its ornamental value makes it a popular choice for woodland gardens and shaded landscapes.
